senses.de: To find out something for sure
senses.ex: The police is trying to ascertain the truth about the incident.

Tips.title: Investigative Context
Tips.description: Used when exploring or investigating an issue or fact, like a detective seeking answers.
Tips.example: The researcher will ascertain if the data supports the hypothesis.

Tips.title: Neutral Tone
Tips.description: Conveys no emotion; it's used for stating facts or findings objectively.
Tips.example: The audit will ascertain the company's financial health.

Tips.title: Formal Expression
Tips.description: Appropriate for formal writing or speaking, not casual conversations.
Tips.example: We must ascertain the event's success through participant feedback.

senses.ex: You should ascertain that the information is correct before sharing it.

Tips.title: Double Checking
Tips.description: Suggests verifying or confirming information that may already be known or assumed.
Tips.example: Please ascertain the guests have all RSVP'd before ordering the catering.

Tips.title: Responsibility
Tips.description: Carries an implied duty to verify something carefully and responsibly.
Tips.example: It's the manager's job to ascertain that all safety protocols are followed.

Tips.title: Pre-Action Check
Tips.description: Done before making decisions or taking action to ensure correctness.
Tips.example: Ascertain the accuracy of the report before presenting to the board.

Confirm.wordDefinition:
Ascertain means to find out for sure, to determine or discover, whereas confirm means to verify or make certain something that was previously uncertain.

Once you have this information, you could then confirm the opening hours by double-checking them with the store.

Ascertain is more often used when trying to discover or figure something out, whereas confirm is used to affirm or validate something that is already known or suspected.

Determine.wordDefinition:
The words ascertain and determine have similar meanings, but differ slightly in their usage.

To determine means to come to a decision or conclusion after careful thought or investigation. For example, you might determine the best course of action after considering all the available information.

Ascertain is used to make sure of something, while determine is used to make a decision or reach a conclusion.

Discover.wordDefinition:
Discover is used when we find something that we didn't know existed or were unaware of. It means to come across something by chance or accident.

For example, a scientist might discover a new species in a remote forest that no one knew existed before.

In simpler terms, you use ascertain when you want to prove or confirm something, and discover when you want to find something new that was previously unknown.

Establish.wordDefinition:
Establish means to create, build, or set up something. It implies that there is a need to create a new entity or situation.

For example, you might establish a new business by creating a business plan, finding investors, and putting all the necessary resources together.

Ascertain is used when you want to find out or verify something that already exists, whereas establish is used when you want to create or set up something new.

Find out.wordDefinition:
Find out means to discover something, often through asking questions, researching or simply stumbling upon it. It is more commonly used in everyday language and informal situations.

Example: I need to find out what time the movie starts.

Ascertain implies a methodical and deliberate approach to uncovering information, whereas find out can be accidental or informal.

Identify.wordDefinition:
Identify means to recognize or establish the particular characteristics, qualities or identity of something or someone.

It is often used to describe the act of recognizing or naming someone or something that is already known. For example, you might identify a friend from a distance by recognizing their face or clothing.

In simpler terms, ascertain means to find out something you don't know, while identify means to recognize something you already know.

Learn.wordDefinition:
'Ascertaining' refers to finding out something with complete certainty or confirming a fact, while 'learning' refers to acquiring knowledge about a subject or skill.

You would use learn if you were studying for a test or trying to gain knowledge about a particular subject - you might say you learned a lot about biology after reading a textbook or attending lectures.

Ascertain is more about confirming existing facts, while 'learning' is about acquiring new knowledge.

Verify.wordDefinition:
Verify on the other hand, means to confirm the truth, accuracy, or validity of something. It's often used when you have a claim or statement, and you want to make sure it's true.

For example, if someone tells you that they received an award, you might verify this by checking with a trusted source or seeing the award certificate yourself.

Ascertain is used to learn or discover new information, while verify is used to confirm or validate existing information.

quotes.Text: My theory is that the way you cope with the depths will ascertain the heights that you reach - they are intimately connected - and if you have a lust for life, you are also going to have a lust for death.
quotes.Title: British Artist
quotes.Name: Sebastian Horsley

quotes.Text: I soon became convinced... that all the theorizing would be empty brain exercise and therefore a waste of time unless one first ascertained what the population of the universe really consists of.
quotes.Title: Swiss Scientist
quotes.Name: Fritz Zwicky

quotes.Text: Court proceedings, except for certain limited situations, are open to the public. This is for the protection of the accused, to be certain to ascertain that there is a fair trial.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Walter Cronkite

quotes.Text: How important it is to ascertain the will of God, before we undertake anything, because we are then not only blessed in our own souls, but also the work of our hands will prosper.
quotes.Title: English Clergyman
quotes.Name: George Muller

quotes.Text: When you have quick scenes, it becomes difficult to ascertain where your character fits and where they're going. I always enjoy scenes that have a movement to them.
quotes.Title: Australian Actor
quotes.Name: Benedict Samuel

quotes.Text: Whenever a youth is ascertained to possess talents meriting an education which his parents cannot afford, he should be carried forward at the public expense.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: James Madison

quotes.Text: Instead of establishing facts, we have to overthrow errors; instead of ascertaining what is, we have to chase from our imaginations what is not.
quotes.Title: Scottish Writer
quotes.Name: Frances Wright

quotes.Text: A great man does not seek applause or place; he seeks for truth; he seeks the road to happiness, and what he ascertains, he gives to others.
quotes.Title: American Lawyer
quotes.Name: Robert Green Ingersoll

quotes.Text: What a man believes may be ascertained, not from his creed, but from the assumptions on which he habitually acts.
quotes.Title: Irish Playwright
quotes.Name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.Text: Whether the family of the Clarkes were of Norman extraction cannot be easily ascertained.
quotes.Title: British Theologian
quotes.Name: Adam Clarke
